specificLearningOutcomes: sort objects according to similar attributes in different situations
match objects with similar attributes in the environment

create patterns of different sizes and shapes using real objects
appreciate the use of sorting and grouping items in day-to-day activities

specificLearningOutcomes: count numbers forward up to 50

fill in missing numbers in number patterns up to 20

create scenarios where addition is relevant i.e there are two apples on the table, add three more, how many apples are there
use flashcards with addition problems to practise quick recall of basic facts

use the ' - ' and '='signs in writing subtraction sentences

work out missing numbers in patterns involving subtraction of whole numbers up to 50

use ' - ' and '=' signs in writing subtraction sentences

specificLearningOutcomes: collect objects of different lengths from the immediate environment
compare the length of objects using longer than, shorter than, and same as

specificLearningOutcomes: collect objects with different masses from the immediate environment

appreciate measuring mass using arbitrary units in the environment

in turn, use safe objects to identify those heavier than, lighter than, or same as

play games involving mass using digital devices
keyInquiryQuestions: How can you compare the mass of two or more objects?
